content.content: 1727×624 42.5 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.    Peg883×624 136 KB   After the downturn this last week,  at that snapback to peg. Tim is dubbing this “tourniquet Thursday” because he wants the bleeding to stop.    Over the last week DAI max and min 1.12 <-> .81.   A wee spike on Curve1530×349 32.4 KB   We’ve written about Curve as a settlement layer before, but how about 2 billion in trading to make the point. This is 3pool, on just Thursday.    4 billion in real volume, according to Messari. Busy week.   DAI Supply1362×745 81.1 KB   DAI is supply-managed well but is still on the decline following the broader market. TVL is still in double digits at 10.6 billion. Overall collateralization is trending safer at 166%.    2.8 billion in the PSM, large outflows are not a surprise to anyone – we hope. If you went on vacation, maybe don’t check your phone?   Vault changes1093×860 137 KB   On a weekly granular level, unwinding is led by premier assets like ETH-A, ETH-C, and WBTC-A. There are still almost 2000 ETH-A vaults, so these are healthy users taking care and protecting against liquidations.    While 200 billion in overall crypto wealth evaporated,  liquidations were orderly and efficient. There were three million in fees, 30 million in debt auctioned, and 15 unique keepers/takers.   Net burn701×601 42.9 KB   Net burn this week of 1.141B DAI.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown of system changes.   Vaults at risk by bucket, mostly moving towards medium and low risk.   Risky debt at 1.731050×422 58.3 KB   Low risk gets slammed with another 23% down candle.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  We Are aing for Your Feedback Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.  Credit @twblack88
Artem_Gordon:   Net burn this week of 876 million.    I have a doubt, the account of Dai issued and Dai paid gives me a balance of 1141061341 DAI. not 800 million, can you explain Artem?
Hey, thanks for catching that; was just some casual human error. I updated
Excelent work Artem and Tim
I love Dai transparency and analytics, this is priceless

It is great to see DAI maintains its peg during market turbulence. For DAI traded at the min & max value of 0.81 and 1.12, is that constitute a large or small volume? If it is large, should it be concern? I guess if the average price of 0.999729 is a volume weighted average price, then it is all good. Is it volume weighted average?
There is no better promotion that DAI maintaining its peg during the past turbulence days in the crypto market. DAI works, MakerDAO works, a solid team make them works

1727×624 42.9 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades! Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.  Hey, you! Yes, you. We have a couple of questions! Very Short Feedback Survey  The public PDF version is available here.     twitter.com    Maker @MakerDAO  State of Dai 📊  This is our weekly roundup to understand how Dai has performed over the last week.  Let's go!  🧵  1/   4:12 PM - 1 Jun 2022           27                8              Peg1736×1228 236 KB   Some drifts off peg this last week, but back to par quickly.   24 hour versus 7 day1024×802 463 KB   Compared to the week before, a narrower range above and below. The arb is drying up.   DAI Supply2314×1512 278 KB   Big jump in GUNI vaults this last week. TVL accross Maker at 10.9 billion.   DEX Context1708×558 141 KB   Putting that in context on DEX’s. Uniswap is almost double the DAI on Curve.   Relative balances of DAI1242×750 126 KB   Zooming out, though, most DAI (~56%) is still on EOA’s versus pursuing market opportunities.   Current stablecoin ratio1800×712 119 KB   Current stablecoin balances at the time of writing are 4.3 billion in total.   Weekly vault changes2010×1582 354 KB   This week, a continuing pattern of a flight to safety, as macro shakedowns continue to exert pressure on markets. A slight rally though through the weekend. ETH-A is leading vault reductions with 60 fewer vaults and 92 million less debt. Without any price cratering, it looks to be that vault owners are paying down debts. ETH-C picked up a healthy gain of 2.76 million despite fewer vaults over the week.   ETH-A risk portfolio978×1034 63.8 KB   Looking into ETH-A more, the dominating risk category is medium primarily because the largest vault sits at 230% collateralized.   Net Mints again737×602 43 KB   More DAI borrowed than repaid this week. 128 million net mints.   31 liquidations2344×1402 273 KB   31 liquidations this last week, the largest of which was ETH-B on the 26th.   Overall borrowers1242×358 47.1 KB   Overall, borrowers across DeFi are leveling off. Since AAVE liquidity mining has ended, we’ll keep an eye on the lending markets as a whole and see what shakes out.   Market share of ETH and WBTC2952×1608 440 KB   Maker still holds a strong grip on ETH market share, FWIW.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown of changes, expenses, and Ilk updates.  Vaults at risk956×1438 172 KB   Overall most debt is medium risk and well protected. The minor ETH rally is keeping capital risk lower. A 15% and 30% downturn would blow through high and low risk, respectively.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  Credit @twblack88
Hey nice report, Big arb opprtunities in my opinion! Loads of DAI on addresses that could contribute to increase liquidity across markets too

1727×624 42.7 KB   Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades! Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.    Hey, you! Yes, you. We have a couple of questions! Very Short Feedback Survey  The public PDF version is available here.     twitter.com    Maker @MakerDAO  Hey, Maker fam!  This is the new version of State of Dai 📊 — A recap of how Dai has behaved during the last week.  Let's find out.  🧵   1/   6:59 PM - 24 May 2022           17                4              Peg871×630 97.1 KB   DAI peg in ETH pairs has been quiet this week compared to the carnage in the last State of DAI.    24 hours vs. 7-day has a wide range out of peg, The upper and lower range mostly coming from arbitrage through Uniswapv2 vs Sushi.   DAI Supply1355×741 85 KB   Reduction in vaults lead to a slight drop in total value locked: 10.5 billion.   PSM chart looks like a rollercoaster724×384 36.7 KB   USDC PSM nudged above 3 billion.   Weekly vault changes1190×900 151 KB   Weekly vault reductions continue. They were unwinding mostly from ETH-A and WBTC-A.   Net Mints omg737×602 43 KB   Vault numbers go down but weekly borrows have beat out burns for the first week in a while. 120 million net in mints.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown of changes, expenses, and Ilk updates.   Very low vaults at risk where a 25% drop is needed to trigger cascades. Current capital at risk is just 23 million (at the time of writing). The monthly moving average of capital at risk has been 43 million.    Visualizing the hypothetical drawdown at 25%.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  Credit @twblack88

Nice job on putting this together. This seems to be a quiet week, nice enough to catch a much needed breath. Got a question though, min dai value marks around 0.88 in the last 24hs but the graph doesnt show that price being reached. What am I missing here? Thanks!
Great post. Seems pretty smooth considering what has been going on over the past several weeks.
I have the same question, I am quite surprised that it lost 20% of the peg that week, but according to other media it never happened.
Hey, try checking the last 48 hrs. Tim finished this yesterday, but I posted it today after some additions, which means the info is off by 12-24 hours when posted, sorry
thanks for the response! will be checking it out
Hmm, it says that 0.80 was hit on univ2 and sushiswap had a .88 but all other exchanges were still tight to the peg
great info. That 0.80 seems unreal! really surprised that it was actually hit!
What a tremendous arbitrage opportunity for those who took advantage of it.
It’s been happening semi frequently. I’m more impressed it gets picked up by the risk dashboard. We wrote about this with full transactions a few weeks back.

1727×624 42.1 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.    Peg884×626 102 KB   It’s been a dog of a market this last week. Peg mostly trades at a premium through curve rebalancings, broader stablecoin capitulation, and max pain red candles. It feels like 2018 again.   24 hour versus 7 day764×362 52.7 KB   Over the past week or even in the past 24 hours, the DAI peg is still snapping back to par quickly and staying mostly above 1.   DEX's lead the way curve as the ultimate settlement1551×474 79.9 KB   DEX’s lead the way, with most DAI trades settling back to Curve. Ninety-eight million in the past 24 hours.   DAI Supply1359×739 80.5 KB   DAI supply continues to reduce in the face of a market downturn and a decent chunk of USDC PSM burns.    Visualizing the PSM outflow helps to see the drop over time. Balance is now at 3.2 billion in USDC.   Vault changes1564×855 152 KB   Double-digit percentage changes over the week. With ETH-A leading vault reductions, 270 million less supply from 41 fewer vaults.   ETH OI1522×745 66.6 KB   Over the last week, ETH perps and futures evaporated a billion dollars in open interest: 7.4 to 6.5 billion.   Net burn926×610 44.6 KB   A net burn this week, 876 million DAI burned, and most of it over the weekend.  Visit Makerburn for an up-to-the-minute breakdown of system changes.   Not all is lost for users, though; only 17 auctions settled on 1.5 million in debt.   Defi unique borrowers also sad925×395 20 KB   Don’t fret, though; we’re all in this sinking boat together, DeFi unique borrowers peaked a few days ago. Reset back to single digits in the past day. It will rise again; the market is brutal but nothing like a shared struggle to incentivize collective action.   Vaults at risk751×867 106 KB   77 high-risk Vaults through more price drops. At the time of writing on the cusp of two WBTC vaults hitting auction.   Risky debt at 1.731483×445 87.8 KB   9% drop starts to creep into low-risk vaults.   Majority risk buckets still low risk751×487 36.7 KB   Low risk is the majority of the appetite. However, there is more debt in the medium and high-risk categories.   ETH-C Organic demand730×543 39.3 KB   For large vaults and organic demand, ETH-C is leading, with most of its vaults sitting at just over 200% collateralized.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  We Are aing for Your Feedback We value your input! Take our survey to let us know what we might be missing or how to do better. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is for information and communication purposes only.  Credit @twblack88
Artem_Gordon:  nothing like a shared struggle to incentivize collective action.   @cmooney 's words coming out of our …keyboards.
Thanks for this summary. Holding up!
Nice job! Not bad news at all given the week the market’s been having.
Stay vigilant, but yes it could be far worse.
Nice to see given the current circumstances. Need to keep it up!
As always what a great job Artem
